TopicTitle: KSP got a bit of a plug on NBC today....

Articles.Content:
Went to my homepage and saw this:

http://www.nbcnews.com/science/one-giant-leap-kerbalkind-spaceflight-sim-wins-geek-gift-award-2D11741994

Another feather for your cap, Squad! Must be looking like an Indian Chiefs headdress by now!!

Kudos! :cool:

The good news: It's getting publicity.

The bad news: There's a "reputation" to manage!? ugh. No thank you.

That is awesome to see them getting national attention for their hard work. One thing I hope they do though is that they keep the sandbox mode, while I do like the idea of the career mode stuff I like just building and having fun too.
Definitely glad it won out over the hundred dollar bag of felt

The bad news: There's a "reputation" to manage!? ugh. No thank you.

Reputation isn't bad. Think of it as this: The more acts of defiant badarsery you accomplish, the more funds you can squeeze from the Kerbish politburo. Gotta fight for that budget!

Science Geek Gift of the Year 2013 !

O-o

will we get a budget in Career mode for version 0.23 ??

Reputation isn't bad. Think of it as this: The more acts of defiant badarsery you accomplish, the more funds you can squeeze from the Kerbish politburo. Gotta fight for that budget!

Aaaannnnddd...bad news for those of us indifferent about life and death of their Kerbals With reputation in place you'll gotta bring 'em home, guys

Woot!

Congrats Squad. Some good coverage that is well deserved.

Good to see KSP getting some mainstream press attention. It's one of the most interesting game ideas in recent years IMO, and I think a lot of people would enjoy it if they tried it. Minecraft showed there is a huge audience of people who want to build things.

That is awesome to see them getting national attention for their hard work. One thing I hope they do though is that they keep the sandbox mode, while I do like the idea of the career mode stuff I like just building and having fun too.

They have said sandbox mode will always be in the game so no worries there, and even if it somehow wasn't the game could be easily modded to unlock all the parts.
well done squad, with this and the third anniversary sale on steam you should get lots more players.
